page.title: 18HEALTH AT SANDHEAD
page.content: Our doctor is one of 3 who look after the well being of the communities around the shores of Luce Bay, from the Mull of Galloway almost to Portwilliam, a distance of well over 40 kilometres of coastline. Like the minister the doctor needs his car! He travels extensively and often has to visit patients in the small hospital in Stranraer, where all but the most dangerous illnesses are treated. Very seriously ill people are taken either to Dumfries, 120 kilometres along the VERY BUSY A75 Euro-route, or to Ayr which is 96 kilometres north on a twisting twining road! The doctor's surgery is in the village and in common with his colleagues in Drummore and Glenluce, he does his own drugs dispensing thereby alleviating the need to visit chemists in Stranraer, 10 kilometres away.
